meanings.definition: A person killed or injured in a war or accident.
meanings.sent1: The soldier was a casualty of the battle.
meanings.sent2: The car crash resulted in multiple casualties.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef was a casualty of the kitchen, always burning himself.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn is often a casualty in the strategy.
meanings.sent5: The casualty of the storm was evident in the fallen trees and damaged houses.

meanings.definition: An accident or disaster resulting in death or injury.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake was a major casualty for the town.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane caused many casualties along the coast.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a casualty when it started raining unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The casualty of the fire was the loss of valuable documents.
meanings.sent5: The casualty of the race was the runner who tripped and fell.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is harmed or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The fragile vase was a casualty of the clumsy cat.
meanings.sent2: The environment is often a casualty of industrial development.
meanings.sent3: The casualty of the party was the cake that fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of nature versus technology, the casualty is usually nature.
meanings.sent5: The casualty of the argument was their friendship, now strained.
